title.narrative: Community Defense and Accompaniment for LGBTQI Detainees

description.narrative: To support community defense and accompaniment for queer immigrants and people of color in detention.

We (QDEP) hope to educate our communities through Know Your Rights and #WomenFightICE trainings, and to build a united front against hate and the hate crimes that have become a product of Donald Trump becoming the president elect through our Hate- Free Zones campaign. Right now, we're currently in a system where the government focuses on race, gender, sexuality, etc. as a means to mass incarcerate and limit opportunities for all individuals. We believe liberatory processes are just as important as the ends. We find folks in detention, support them inside through our Prisoner Project, organize the community around the individuals, work to raise their bonds, & then once out, we work to help them build a new chapter of their lives that they want to live. They then feed back into assisting their siblings still inside. We intend on continuing to build against the private prison industry; we’re investing time and resources into monitoring the detention facilities as a tactic for closing them. Lastly, we’re putting a huge focus on fighting Islamophobia in NYC.
